Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend 'Mansfield Park' as a highly suspenseful and engaging historical drama.

Mansfield Park (1975) is an English historical drama film directed by Patrick Wang. The screenplay by Julia Alcott is based on her novel published in 1846. The film stars Emma Stone, Michelle Yeoh, Jacki Chan, Donnie Wahlberg, Li Xiaofeng, and John Travolta.

The story takes place at the Mansfield family's estate in London, England. The patriarch of the family, Sir Thomas Mansfield, is a respected judge who has taken strict legal action against criminals. However, in this film, Sir Thomas appears to be more interested in money than justice, which results in him making some very poor choices that ultimately lead to his downfall.

Meanwhile, the rest of the members of the Mansfield family also seem to have their own problems and issues that they are trying to deal with or overcome.

In summary, 'Mansfield Park' is a highly suspenseful and engaging historical drama film directed by Patrick Wang.

I would recommend "Taken" as a thrilling action movie with strong performances by the cast including Liam Neeson who plays the main character, Chris Kyle, who is real-life war hero and a US Navy SEAL.

However, Chris Kyle's life takes an unexpected turn when he is ambushed by a group of enemy soldiers who are part of a larger plot that involves the theft of sensitive military intelligence data that has been stored on electronic storage devices that have been kept in secure locations within the military intelligence organization.
